page.title: 18AMERICAN'S VIEW OF BRECHIN
page.content: Hi.I am one of the 200 Americans living in a US Government housing estate on the northern outskirts of Brechin. My Dad,like all the fathers, works for NATO at RAF Edzell six miles from town.I come from California and have lived in Brechin for 2 years.My Dad has one more year to do here before we all go back to the USA. Brechin is DIFFERENT from home. I feel it cool and rainy here. School is more strict but when I go home I will be ahead of my classmates. I do not eat much Scottish food. Mom buys tacos, hamburgers and pizzas at the American food shop on base. At night I watch TV and go to discos the same as I do at home.I have made a lot of friends in Brechin and I am sure I will miss them when I go home.
